Row.Text: Family Dispute

The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has come to us to settle a family dispute. Their mother has recently passed, leaving behind a modest sum of gold. It was her will, backed by her eldest son, that the money be donated to the city's poor. The {1_RulerDesc}, however, believes that it should be split among the members of their family instead.
We must not dishonour those passed.
It should go to the family. Though we expect a fee.
Simple. The gold is ours.
The City gains +{2_Yield}.
+{2_Yield}.
+20 to the City's [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counter and +{2_Yield}.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s family dispute has ended in their inheritance going to the city.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s family dispute has ended in their inheritance going to their family.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s family dispute has ended in their inheritance going to us.
Fervant Levies
A band of Levies have been taking extra time to train in the hopes to serve their country. A random Levy Unit gains +20 XP.
Governor's Call to Arms
News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pledging their support, the City's {1_RulerDesc} has provided 1 Military Unit to assist in our current war effort.
Governor's Daughter
The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has requested that we allow their beloved daughter a place at our court. This would no doubt displease {2_CityDesc}'s people, however.
Very well. They may take a place at our court.
I must decline.
+20 to the City's [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Resistance Counter and +10% [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Loyalty in the City for the next 20 turns.
No effect.
We have accepted at our court the daughter of the governor of {2_CityDesc}.
We have declined at our court the daughter of the governor of {2_CityDesc}.
Governor's Dissatisfaction
The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has petitioned us for a higher station. They have given us good cause to do so, but we have been advised by our court that this promotion would be costly.
Yes, perhaps we should.
The greedy lout shall get no such thing!
{1_Yield} and the City becomes a [ICON_JFD_DUCHY] State.
+50 to the City's [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counter.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has been elevated to a higher station.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has been denied a higher station.
Governor's Donation
News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Satisfied with our leadership, the {1_RulerDesc} has donated a cache of gold to us. Gain a sum of [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Governor's Garden
The garden at {2_CityDesc} has become a favourite refuge for the city's {1_RulerDesc}. It is said they spend so much time there, however, that it has become a problem for the local government.
Let them have their peace.
They must return to work.
+10 to the City's [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counter and the City's Garden gains +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for the next 20 turns.
-20 to the City's [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counter.[ENDCOLOR]
We have allowed the governor of {2_CityDesc} to remain at their garden.
We have forbidden the governor of {2_CityDesc} to remain at their garden.
Governor's Gift
News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In awe of our leadership, the {1_RulerDesc} has gifted their finest horse to us. Gain 1 [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horse.
Governor's Marriage
The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has arranged to be married to a young noble. We might wish to take this opportunity to make a public affair out of the ceremony.
Yes, this marriage is everyone's concern.
No, it is no one else's concern.
{1_Yield} and all cities begin celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 3 turns.
The City begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 5 turns.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s marriage has become a public ceremony.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s marriage has remained a private ceremony.
Governor's Request
We have been petitioned by the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} for a donation of gold, to sustain their tireless allegiance to us.
Very well, they may have this gold.
Absolutely not! Is it not enough that they serve beneath me?
{1_Yield}.
+30 to the City's [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counter.
We have agreed to the governor of {2_CityDesc}'s request for a donation of gold.
We have turned down the governor of {2_CityDesc}'s request for a donation of gold.
The Great Ball
Apparently, a Great Ball is to be hosted at the pleasure of the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc}, but we were not invited![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from one of the options below...
Well, what's a Ball? I suppose it would be frightfully dull...
This is an insult! We will be in attendance.
The [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 5 turns.
The City's [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' ends and +{2_Yield}.
We have chosen not to attend the Great Ball at {2_CityDesc}, pleasing our court.
We have attended the Great Ball at {2_CityDesc}, despite having not been invited.
The Great Ball

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Our attendance at the Great Ball hosted at {2_CityDesc} was met with much displeasure and discomfort by its guests. +10 to the City's [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Resistance Counter.
The Great Ball

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As it turns out, we were invited to the Great Ball hosted at {2_CityDesc} after all! The City begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 3 turns.
Homosexual Governor
Rumours have spread that the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has taken to the bed of a servant - of the same sex! The rumours have left their court in disarray, and we have been asked to step in.
We do not address mere rumours.
What of it? Their private life is their concern.
30 to the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital's [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Celebration Counter.
+{2_Yield}.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s homosexual affair has been dismissed as being no more than mere rumour.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s homosexual affair has been dismissed as being their business alone.
Hunting Accident

The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has recently been killed by their brother in a hunting accident. Reportedly, they were mistaken for a deer and shot dead with an arrow to the... eye![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from one of the options below...
Nothing suspicious here.
We had better investigate this.
The City's [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Celebration and [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counters are reset.
-50 to the City's [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Celebration Counter and -50 to the City's [ICON_JFD_RED_FIST] Revolt Counter.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s death in a hunting accident has been ruled accidental.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s death in a hunting accident has been ruled suspicious.
Hunting Accident

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New evidence reveals that the death of the former {1_RulerDesc} was, indeed as we expected, an accident. +10 to the City's [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Celebration Counter.
Hunting Accident

A servant has come forth claiming that the death of the former {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} was no accident. They allege that the governor's brother had first ordered the servants to vacate the area, before reportedly luring the {1_RulerDesc} into a position in which to be targeted at a distance.
As we said - nothing suspicious here.
+40 to the City's [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Celebration Counter.
The governor of {2_CityDesc}'s death in a hunting accident has been confirmed as accidental.
Incompetent Governor

The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has time and again been called out for their gross incompetence. Finally, however, they have gone too far - having thrown our delegate from their court and ranting that such "overseering" is unneeded![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from one of the options below...
Perhaps we can look the other way.
{1_Yield} and +10% [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Loyalty in the City for the next 20 turns.
The incompetent governor of {2_CityDesc} continues to make a mockery of their office.
Incompetent Governor
The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc}, in their latest display of incompetence, has let the local Granary burn to the ground![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from one of the options below...
An accident, surely.
The City loses its Granary.
The incompetent governor of {2_CityDesc} has cost us a Granary in the city.
Incompetent Governor

The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc}, in their latest display of incompetence, has misplaced the city's ledger, resulting in a loss in our income![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from one of the options below...
An innocent mistake.
{1_Yield}.
The incompetent governor of {2_CityDesc} has cost us a sum of Gold.
Insane Governor

It has been reported that the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has slipped into madness. They waste away the nights prowling the streets, howling at the moon and cackling at passersby. Something must be done before they endanger the city.
We cannot dishonour their family; they must remain.
{1_Yield} and +{2_Yield}.
The demented governor of {2_CityDesc} remains at their station, averting dishonour to their family - albeit at the expense of the people.
Insane Governor

The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has recently appointed their favourite stallion as a member of their government! It is clear that their madness is only worsening, and that we must act before they become a danger to the city.
What harm can this appointment do?
{1_Yield} and gain 2 [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has appointed a Horse to advise them on political matters.
Insane Governor
The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has fled the city, leaving a disemboweled servant and a distraught spouse in their wake! Our negligence has cost a servant their life and us our reputation.
They must be brought before a court and tried!
We must appoint a replacement and hide this embarrassment.
+{2_Yield}.
The City begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 20 turns.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has been brought before a court and tried for their crime.
A new governor of {2_CityDesc} has been appointed, averting any attention to the recently murdered servant.
Insane Governor

The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc}, believing themself to be the living incarnation of a God, has ordered that the city's Assembly be converted into a lavish palace. It is unclear whether their madness will ever cease.
Let them have their palace.
{1_Yield} in the City and the City's Assembly gains +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has converted the city's Assembly into a palace.
Jousting Tournament
The {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has invited us to compete in a Jousting Tournament, to be hosted at their expense. It would be an opportunity for us to prove our mettle in the public eye.
It is a Tournament then!
We have no time for games.
Not with that mad-man!
The City begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 5 turns.
The City gains +{2_Yield}.
+{2_Yield}.
We have agreed to the governor of {2_CityDesc}'s Jousting Tournament.
We have turned down the governor of {2_CityDesc}'s Jousting Tournament.
We have turned down the governor of {2_CityDesc}'s Jousting Tournament, remembering that they were insane!
Jousting Tournament
News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In our Jousting Tournament with the {1_RulerDesc}, we have emerged as the loser! -50 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Jousting Tournament

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Alas, the city's demented {1_RulerDesc} has challenged us naked! We are forced to forfeit. -50 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Jousting Tournament

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In our Jousting Tournament with the {1_RulerDesc}, we have emerged as the victor! Gain a sum of [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Levies Desert!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Learning the fate that awaits them, some of our Levies have thrown down their arms and fled! A random Levy Unit takes 20 Damage.
New Birth

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After much hardship, a new child has been born to the city's {1_RulerDesc}. The City begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 3 turns.
Tireless Governor
One of our most trusted allies, the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc}, is said to have collapsed from exhaustion. Although it pains them to admit, perhaps it is time that they step down.
That is their decision to make, not ours.
{1_Yield} and +{2_Yield}.
The tireless governor of {2_CityDesc} continues to toil away in their office.
Tireless Governor's Death

News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unfortunately, the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has died. Perhaps if we had heeded the signs... The City's [ICON_JFD_BLUE_FIST] Celebration Counter is reset.
Tortured Children

We have learned that the {1_RulerDesc} of {2_CityDesc} has been torturing young children; locking them in dungeons and starving them to the brink of death. One, however, has escaped, and awaits in tapered hope that we might intervene.
Yes, the governor will be fined and instructed to stop.
+{2_Yield}.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has been fined for their torture of children and asked that they not to do it again.
War Machine
News from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_CityDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To aide in our current war effort, the {1_RulerDesc} has provided us with a secret war machine. Gain 1 Siege Tower at the City.
We must remove this governor from office.
The City enters [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance for 1 turn and begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 10 turns.
Governor of {2_CityDesc} removed from office.
The governor of {2_CityDesc} has been removed from their office for malfeasance.
